markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub! ‚ù§Ô∏è

To convert interface to int in golang, use interface.(int) method, it will convert interface to int. You have to only pass your int type in interface.

Follow the below tutorial if you are struggling with installing GO in windows.

https://aguidehub.com/blog/how-to-install-golang-in-windows/

Today, I will show you how do I convert a interface to int in golang, as above mentioned I‚Äôm going to use interface.(int) method.

Let‚Äôs start our Golang convert interface to int example

main.go

package main

import (
	"fmt"
)

func passInterface(v interface{}) {
	b, ok := v.(int)
	fmt.Println(ok)
	fmt.Println(b)
}

func main() {
	passInterface(8)
}

In the above example, we have converted the interface value to a int and printed in golang console. let‚Äôs check the output.

Output

true
8

I hope it helps you, All the best üëç.

Try it Yourself
